definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: The second function is to support brokering trust relationships.
sentences.chinese: 第二个函数是为了支持中介信任关系。

sentences.english: Save the mediation module and restart it.
sentences.chinese: 保存中介模块，并重新启动它。

sentences.english: Allowing or disallowing a message to be delivered based on some conditional logic in the mediation.
sentences.chinese: 基于中介中一些条件逻辑允许或禁止消息的分发。

sentences.english: Message flows should be stateless engines in the mediation activities.
sentences.chinese: 消息流应该是中介活动中的无状态引擎。

sentences.english: The third component, mediations, contributes to the separation of concerns.
sentences.chinese: 第三种组件，中介，有助于分离业务。

sentences.english: The creation and use of mediation policies is best described by example.
sentences.chinese: 用例子描述中介策略的创建和使用再好不过了。

sentences.english: Originally what was happening was all those loans were going through banks and financial intermediaries.
sentences.chinese: 起先做的是这些所有贷款要经过银行和金融中介机构。

sentences.english: A fault message should be generated whenever a failure occurs at an intermediary.
sentences.chinese: 每当中介体发生故障时，都应该生成错误消息。

sentences.english: The cultivation of the intermediary of Qingdao should do a good job in the three major impetuses.
sentences.chinese: 青岛市中介组织的培育应该抓好三大著力点。

sentences.english: So there is a lack of insurance kinds, intermediary mechanisms are imperfect.
sentences.chinese: 中介机构不完善，运动员保险中介人才匮乏。

sentences.english: So there is a lack of insurance kinds, intermediary mechanisms are imperfect.
sentences.chinese: 中介机构不完善，运动员保险中介人才匮乏。

sentences.english: Finally, we will code a simple mediation that will enable us to test the log writer.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我们编码用于测试日志写入器的简单中介。

sentences.english: Mediations can augment message contents with data obtained from a database.
sentences.chinese: 中介可以利用从数据库获取的数据扩充消息内容。

sentences.english: In addition, Tao Yuanming's poetry also has an impact on this school.
sentences.chinese: 此外，苏词还以唐诗为中介接受了陶诗的影响。

sentences.english: But they're often falling into the hands of unscrupulous labor brokers.
sentences.chinese: 但他们往往落入黑心的劳工中介手中。

sentences.english: Or a group of coops may hire a financial intermediary.
sentences.chinese: 合作社组织还可选择与金融中介协作。

definition: developer (of real estate, a commercial product etc)
second-hand house/house acquired indirectly through a middle-man
a deal where the parties collude to sign an under-the-table "yin contract" 陰合同|阴合同 as well as an ostensibly genuine "yang contract" 陽合同|阳合同 in order to deceive authorities
